metadata.title: CVE-2024-36908 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:blk-iocost: do not WARN if iocg was already offlinedIn iocg_pay_debt(), warn is triggered if 'active_list' is empty, whichis intended to confirm iocg is active when it has debt. However, warncan be triggered during a blkcg or disk removal, if iocg_waitq_timer_fn()is run at that time:  WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 2344971 at block/blk-iocost.c:1402iocg_pay_debt+0x14c/0x190  Call trace:  iocg_pay_debt+0x14c/0x190  iocg_kick_waitq+0x438/0x4c0  iocg_waitq_timer_fn+0xd8/0x130  __run_hrtimer+0x144/0x45c  __hrtimer_run_queues+0x16c/0x244  hrtimer_interrupt+0x2cc/0x7b0The warn in this situation is meaningless. Since this iocg is beingremoved, the state of the 'active_list' is irrelevant, and 'waitq_timer'is canceled after removing 'active_list' in ioc_pd_free(), which ensuresiocg is freed after iocg_waitq_timer_fn() returns.Therefore, add the check if iocg was already offlined to avoid warnwhen removing a blkcg or disk.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
